com.tokelon.toktales.core.content.graphics

Interface IBitmap

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, IDisposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAndroidBitmap, ISTBBitmap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidBitmap, AndroidCodepointBitmap, BitmapImpl, STBBitmap

    public interface IBitmap
extends IDisposable
    Contains pixel data and meta information of an image.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of this bitmap.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of this bitmap.

      • getFormat

        int getFormat()
        Returns the color format of this bitmap.

        This can be one of the included formats (ex. FORMAT_RGBA_8888), or a completely different one.

        Returns:
        A flag indicating the format.

      • getData

        ByteBuffer getData()
        Returns the bitmap data.

        Note that while some implementations may return the backing buffer directly, others may allocate a new one for each bitmap, or even for each call. Therefore prefer using getData(ByteBuffer).

        Returns:
        A buffer containing the bitmap data.
        See Also:
        getData(ByteBuffer)

      • getData

        void getData(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Copies the bitmap data into the given buffer.

        The buffer's position will be incremented by the number of bytes written.

        Parameters:
        buffer -
        Throws:
        BufferOverflowException - If for buffer Buffer.remaining() < getByteCount().
        See Also:
        getByteCount()

      • getByteCount

        int getByteCount()
        Returns the number of bytes this bitmap's data uses.

        This is also the minimum capacity a buffer needs to contain the data.

        Returns:
        The data byte count of this bitmap.
